reasoning: Acute liver failure is a well-defined acute condition with incidence estimated at ~1.5 per 100k globally. US data shows 2,000-7,000 cases/year (~0.6-2.0 per 100k), with higher rates in developing countries due to viral hepatitis complications.
source: Lee WM et al. (2004). Acute liver failure. N Engl J Med. 350:800-808
